title: Extremal descendant integrals on moduli spaces of curves: An inequality discovered and proved in collaboration with AI
summary: For the pure $ψ$-class intersection numbers $D(\textbf{e})=\langle τ_{e_1} \cdots τ_{e_n} \rangle_g$ on the moduli space $\overline{\mathcal{M}}_{g,n}$ of stable curves, we determine for which choices of $\textbf{e}=(e_1, \ldots, e_n)$ the value of $D(\textbf{e})$ becomes extremal. The intersection number is minimal for powers of a single $ψ$-class (i.e. all $e_i$ but one vanish), whereas maximal
